templates.title: MariaDB
templates.description: MariaDB v10.6+ Container with default settings
templates.notes: Valid MariaDB image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/_/mariadb)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: MYSQL_VERSION
env.label: MariaDB version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the MariaDB Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/_/mariadb)

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.label: Database name(s)
env.description: Space-separated list of database names to create

env.name: MYSQL_PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the database instance (check that it is not in use)

env.name: MOUNT_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Optional, Path on host to use for the persistent data directory. Data files will be stored in the mount root under the ./container-name/data subdirectory. For linux, `/var/lib/portainer` is recommended.

env.name: MYSQLD_PARAMETERS
env.label: Optional parameters
env.description: Optional parameters to the mariadbd daemon such as `--skip-grant-tables` or `--sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION`

templates.title: MySQL
templates.notes: Valid MySQL image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: MYSQL_VERSION
env.label: MySQL version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the MySQL Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql)

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.label: Database name(s)
env.description: Space-separated list of database names to create

env.name: MYSQL_PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the database instance (check that it is not in use)

env.name: MOUNT_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Optional, Path on host to use for the persistent data directory. Data files will be stored in the mount root under the ./container-name/data subdirectory. For linux, `/var/lib/portainer` is recommended.

env.name: MYSQLD_PARAMETERS
env.label: Optional parameters
env.description: Optional parameters to the mysqld daemon such as `--skip-grant-tables` (safe mode) or `--sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION` (for AWS RDS permission issues)

templates.title: NGINX Hello World
templates.description: NGINX webserver that serves a simple page containing its hostname, IP address and port as well as the request URI and the local time of the webserver.

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the NGINX server (check that it is not in use)

templates.title: NGINX & PHP (Alpine)
templates.notes: Valid PHP/NGINX image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: Trafex version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the Trafex Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx/tags)

env.name: TRAFEX_PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the php server (check that it is not in use)

env.name: PHP_WEB_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Path on host to use for the PHP application root. For Windows, enclose in quotes and escape path separators with double-backslashes.

env.name: RESTART
env.label: Restart
env.description: Restart behavior (on failure or Docker engine restart)

templates.title: PHP/Apache (Debian)
templates.description: The official PHP/Apache image on Debian Linux (php:latest) with selectable version and other options
templates.notes: Valid PHP image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/_/php/tags)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: PHP version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the Trafex Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx/tags)

env.name: PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the php server (check that it is not in use)

env.name: PHP_EXTENSIONS
env.label: Additional extensions
env.description: Comma-separated list of additional PHP extensions to install - without spaces! (e.g. 'pgsql,pdo_mysql,sqlite3,odbc,redis,imagick,bcmath,imap,ldap,soap,tidy,xmlrpc,zlib')

env.name: PHP_MEMORY_LIMIT
env.label: Memory limit
env.description: PHP script memory limit (128M is the default but 256M or 512M is recommended)

env.name: APACHE_SERVER_NAME
env.label: Server name
env.description: Apache server name (domain name)

env.name: PHP_WEB_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Path on host to use for the PHP application root. For Windows, enclose in quotes and escape path separators with double-backslashes.

env.name: RESTART
env.label: Restart
env.description: Restart behavior (on failure or Docker engine restart)

templates.title: Traefik: NGINX Hello World
templates.description: Reverse-proxied NGINX webserver that serves a simple page containing its hostname, IP address and port as well as the request URI and the local time of the webserver. Uses Traefik to manage ACME SSL certificates. Ensure you are run the Traefik: SSL Reverse Proxy Manager before deployment.

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: DOMAIN
env.label: Domain name
env.description: Enter full domain name (without the http:// part) for Traefik integration. You MUST set your A records PRIOR to running the stack in order for SSL certificates to be automatically generated correctly.

templates.title: Traefik: NGINX & PHP (Alpine)
templates.description: Reverse-proxied PHP-FPM 8.3 & Nginx 1.24 on Alpine Linux (trafex/php-nginx). Uses Traefik to manage ACME SSL certificates. Ensure you are run the Traefik: SSL Reverse Proxy Manager before deployment.
templates.notes: Valid PHP/NGINX image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: Trafex version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the Trafex Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx/tags)

env.name: DOMAIN
env.label: Domain name
env.description: Enter full domain name (without the http:// part) for Traefik integration. You MUST set your A records PRIOR to running the stack in order for SSL certificates to be automatically generated correctly.

env.name: PHP_WEB_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Path on host to use for the PHP application root. For Windows, enclose in quotes and escape path separators with double-backslashes.

env.name: RESTART
env.label: Restart
env.description: Restart behavior (on failure or Docker engine restart)
